description: Detects when a system—government, corporate, or technological—limits public options, suppresses choice, or trains helplessness. Flags structural erasure of agency.

variables.D(t): User/system deferral structures (e.g. opaque interfaces, forced defaults)
variables.A(t): System authority signals (e.g. monopoly, 'expert only' access)
variables.C(t): Option diversity, public tools, feedback loops

response: Healthy systems make space for choice, error, and participation. Reinstate opt-outs, public tools, and agency education. Control without consent is collapse.
